hero.name: James Zhang
hero.subtitle: I bridge the gap between Data Engineering and Analytics.

about.title: About me
about.primary: I am a Data Analyst with a degree in Cognitive Systems from UBC. My journey began in competitive gaming, where I learned that the best strategies are built on data, not guesses. As an Esports Team Lead, I used analytics to optimize win rates, and now I apply that same rigor to building data pipelines and dashboards. I specialize in Python, SQL, and translating complex metrics into actionable insights for communities and stakeholders.
about.secondary: Beyond the code, I'm deeply embedded in gaming cultureâ€”often analyzing patch notes or optimizing character builds in games like Umamusume. I want to design games.

projects.title: Community Analytics Dashboard
projects.description: A full-stack analytics solution serving 3,000+ unique users. I engineered a data pipeline to digitize messy user-submitted data and stored the telemetry data in DuckDB for high-performance querying whilst visualizing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in an interactive Streamlit dashboard.

projects.title: LLM Text Detection Research
projects.description: Research focused on distinguishing AI-generated text from human writing. I implemented and tuned Random Forest and Logistic Regression classifiers on large-scale linguistic corpora, achieving high accuracy in bilingual text classification tasks.

projects.title: Competitive Meta Analysis (CM4)
projects.description: A deep dive into the competitive meta for the Champions Meeting (CM4). I conducted exploratory data analysis on game mechanics and character stats to identify 'meta' strategies, creating comprehensive visualizations to analyze the correlation between character attributes and race win rates.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: I'm currently looking for Data Analyst and Analytics Engineer opportunities. Feel free to reach out!
